In celebration of 50 years of Polo, we embarked on an unique journey through South Africa - the home of our currently smallest Volkswagen. Since 1996, the Kariega plant in the Eastern Cape has been the beating heart of Polo production. Over 1.9 million Polos and 440,000 Polo Vivos have rolled off its lines ‚Äì including every single Polo GTI in the world. Together with media guests and content creators, we explored the Kariega plant, convinced ourselves of the Polo‚Äòs racing qualities at Simola Hillclimb and experienced the comfort of our Polo on the long ride from Knysna to Cape Town.  üó∫Ô∏è The Polo has long been an international success story. Series production of the Polo I began in March 1975 at our headquarters in Wolfsburg. But as the model increased in importance, production was spread to other locations around the world, including Spain, Argentina, South Africa, Slovenia, China, Brazil and India. With more than 20 million units built, the Polo is one of the world‚Äôs most successful small compact vehicles.  ‚öôÔ∏è The Kariega plant, around 1,000 km south of Johannesburg, covers an area of 518,378 m2 (= 70 football pitches). In addition to the Polo and Polo Vivo, engines for the Polo Vivo are also produced there. With almost 4,000 employees, @VWGA is the largest private employer in the Nelson Mandela Bay metropolitan region, which includes Kariega.  #Volkswagen #Polo #Polo50
